p: Although the Southern cluster comprised only four mtDNA haplotypes, this group had the most genetic variation (nucleotide diversity, π = 0.016; mean number of nucleotide differences, K = 17.50; Table 1). Nine mtDNA haplotypes in the Northern cluster resulted in values of π = 0.010, and K = 11.44, and, although there were 19 haplotypes in the Central cluster, these diversity values were lowest (i.e., π = 0.003 and K = 3.68; Table 1). Genetic differentiation was highest between Southern versus Central clusters ( F ST = 0.659) whereas Northern versus Central differentiation was lowest (Supporting Information Table S6.7).
